guidelines.title: Guidelines

about.title: About This Application
about.description: This IrrigAIte UA uses scientifically validated methods based on international agricultural standards and research specific to Ukrainian agricultural conditions. The system incorporates:

features.scientificModels: Scientifically validated models calibrated for Ukrainian regions
features.realTimeWeather: Real-time weather data integration for accurate estimations
features.localAdjustments: Adjustments for local climatic conditions across all Ukrainian regions
features.internationalStandards: Adherence to international agricultural standards for crop water requirements

step1.title: Select Your Region
step1.description: Choose your Ukrainian region from the interactive region selector. You can:

details.search: Search for your region using the search bar
details.select: Click on your desired region card to select it

details.fetchWeather: Fetches real-time weather data for your selected region
details.applyAdjustments: Applies region-specific adjustments for local climate conditions
details.displayResults: Displays the current temperature and PET value

step3.title: Calculate Irrigation Needs (Optional)
step3.note: The system will determine crop growth stage and provide specific irrigation timing and amounts.

steps.selectCrop: Select crop type and climate classification
steps.applyRecommendations: Apply recommendations to your irrigation schedule

inputRequirements.referenceNote: Not sure about actual field capacity, irrigation efficiency or active layer depth?
inputRequirements.referenceLinkText: to find out the range of possible values.

accurateResults.title: For Accurate Results
accurateResults.currentMeasurements: Use current soil moisture measurements when available
accurateResults.selectVariety: Select the crop variety that most closely matches your planting
accurateResults.considerMicroclimate: Consider local microclimatic conditions that may affect results
accurateResults.validateExpertise: Validate recommendations against local agricultural expertise

irrigationPlanning.title: For Irrigation Planning
irrigationPlanning.checkRegularly: Check calculations regularly during the growing season
irrigationPlanning.adjustRainfall: Adjust for rainfall and other water inputs
irrigationPlanning.considerSoil: Consider soil type and drainage characteristics
irrigationPlanning.monitorStress: Monitor crop stress indicators in the field

dataQuality.title: Data Quality
dataQuality.accurateDates: Ensure accurate planting dates for growth stage calculations
dataQuality.representativeSamples: Use representative soil samples for moisture measurements
dataQuality.systemEfficiency: Account for irrigation system efficiency in application rates
dataQuality.keepRecords: Keep records for seasonal comparison and validation

scientificFoundation.title: Scientific Foundation

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.internationalStandards: Based on internationally recognized agricultural standards
methodology.regionalData: Incorporates regional climate data and adjustments

scientificFoundation.note: The IrrigAIte UA provides scientifically-based estimates for irrigation planning. Results should be used as guidance alongside local agricultural expertise, field observations, and site-specific conditions for optimal irrigation management.

header.title: About Us
header.subtitle: Learn about our mission and the science behind the IrrigAIte UA

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.paragraph1: IrrigAIte UA is dedicated to supporting Ukrainian agriculture through precision irrigation guidance. Our mission is to provide farmers and agronomists with scientifically accurate, region-specific evapotranspiration calculations that optimize water usage and improve crop yields.
mission.paragraph2: We believe that sustainable agriculture is essential for Ukraine's future, and precise water management plays a crucial role in achieving this goal. Our tools combine cutting-edge research with practical agricultural needs to deliver actionable insights for irrigation decisions.

mlApproach.title: ML-Driven Approach
mlApproach.description: Our PET calculation is powered by a robust, machine learningâ€“based model specifically calibrated for Ukrainian agricultural conditions. It integrates historical temperature data and region-specific coefficients for all oblasts, providing highly accurate predictions across diverse climatic zones. Trained on extensive data from 1971 to 2024, the model delivers exceptional performance, with an RÂ² of 0.85, RMSE of 0.63 mm, and MAE of 0.48 mm, thus ensuring both reliability and precision for irrigation planning.

faoGuidelines.title: FAO Guidelines Integration
faoGuidelines.description: The irrigation recommendations follow FAO (Food and Agriculture Organization) guidelines for crop evapotranspiration calculations (namely, FAO Irrigation and drainage paper 56). We use established crop coefficients and growth stage classifications to provide reliable ETc estimations.

realTimeWeather.title: Real-time Weather Integration
realTimeWeather.description: Our tool integrates with OpenWeatherMap API to fetch current temperature data for accurate real-time PET calculations. This ensures that irrigation recommendations are based on current atmospheric conditions rather than historical averages.

soilMoisture.title: Soil Moisture Assessment
soilMoisture.description: The system incorporates soil moisture content calculations using gravimetric soil moisture, active layer depth, bulk density measurements and general soil water properties. This comprehensive approach ensures irrigation recommendations account for actual soil water availability.

scientificAccuracy.title: Scientific Accuracy
scientificAccuracy.description: Every calculation in our system is based on peer-reviewed research and established agricultural science principles. We continuously update our models to reflect the latest scientific findings.

userFriendlyDesign.title: User-Friendly Design
userFriendlyDesign.description: We believe that powerful tools should be accessible to everyone. Our interface is designed to be intuitive for farmers, students, and researchers alike, regardless of their technical background.

continuousImprovement.title: Continuous Improvement
continuousImprovement.description: We actively seek feedback from users and incorporate new research findings to improve our calculations and recommendations. Your input helps us serve the agricultural community better.

openAccess.title: Open Access
openAccess.description: This tool is offered as a free or paid Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) solution. We believe that access to scientifically grounded irrigation guidance should be available to all, regardless of economic circumstances.

items.realTimeWeather: Real-time weather data from reliable meteorological API
items.ukrainianResearch: Ukrainian agricultural research for regional evaluations using ML-driven approach
items.soilParameters: Soil parameter databases for accurate moisture calculations

items.regionalModels: Regional ML models for precise PET evaluation
items.growthStage: Growth stage determination based on planting dates
items.cropCoefficient: Crop coefficient application for ETc calculation

items.errorHandling: Error handling for edge cases and data inconsistencies
items.userFeedback: User feedback integration for model improvements

waterqAi.title: WaterQ AI
waterqAi.description: Elevate your irrigation strategy with WaterQ AI, the advanced AI tool for precise and thorough water quality analysis. By adhering to rigorous agronomic criteria and incorporating methodologies from the FAO, DSTU 2730:2015, and global scientific standards, WaterQ AI empowers you to make informed decisions for sustainable and productive agriculture.

cropMap.title: Ukraine Crop Production Map
cropMap.description: Designed for agricultural researchers and remote sensing specialists, this interactive web application offers a compelling visual and analytical platform. It seamlessly merges major crop yield data from Ukraine with diverse remote sensing products. Users can explore various vegetation indices (e.g., NDVI, EVI, NDMI) and utilize integrated statistical functionalities like correlation matrices, regression analysis, trend analysis, and forecasting. This empowers academicians to perform rigorous, data-driven investigations into the complex dynamics between crop performance and observed remote sensing signatures.

soilClimateDb.title: Ukraine Soil and Climate Database
soilClimateDb.description: This dedicated web application presents a comprehensive and integrated database of Ukraine's soil and climate characteristics. Developed to support scientific endeavors in agriculture, climatology, ecology, and soil science, the database systematically compiles information derived from traditional land surveys, extensive hydrometeorological observations, and cutting-edge remote sensing data.

header.title: Support Us

hero.title: Support Agricultural Science and Innovation
hero.description: Your support helps us maintain and improve innovative ML and AI-driven tools for Ukrainian farmers, agricultural scientists and students.

spreadTheWord.title: Spread the Word
spreadTheWord.description: Share our tool with farmers, students, and agricultural scientists. Word-of-mouth is our most powerful tool for reaching those who need irrigation guidance.

provideFeedback.title: Provide Feedback
provideFeedback.description: Help us improve by sharing your experiences, suggestions, and field validation data. Your insights help us make more accurate and useful calculations.

contributeData.title: Contribute Data
contributeData.description: If you have local weather stations or soil data, sharing this information helps us improve our regional models and provide more accurate recommendations.

financialSupport.title: Financial Support
financialSupport.description: Our tool relies on the OpenWeatherMap API, which limits the number of free evaluations available. By purchasing a license key, you help us cover API costs, maintain server infrastructure, and invest in developing new features. Your support â€” even a small contribution â€” makes a big difference and keeps this service running and improving.

developer.title: Meet the Developer
developer.name: Dr. Pavlo Lykhovyd
developer.bio: Dr. Pavlo Lykhovyd is an agricultural engineer and researcher specializing in irrigation management and precision agriculture. With extensive experience in both agricultural science and software development, he created IrrigAIte UA to help Ukrainian farmers optimize their irrigation practices using data-driven approaches.
